title: Creating Schedule G in the Excepted Service

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes a new category called Schedule G in the federal excepted service for noncareer positions that are policy-making or policy-advocating and typically change with a new President. It clarifies which positions fall under this new schedule, updates civil service rules accordingly, and sets guidelines for appointments, especially within the Department of Veterans Affairs.
potential_concerns: The creation of Schedule G could increase political volatility for noncareer policy-making positions, heightening job insecurity among political appointees.
The specific exclusion of political affiliation in Veterans Affairs Schedule G appointments may cause implementation challenges and delays, potentially impacting veterans' policy continuity and care.
Ambiguities in defining which positions fit Schedule G may lead to inconsistent classifications affecting both veterans' service delivery and political appointee career stability.

The expansion of noncareer policy-making roles subject to Presidential transitions might reduce institutional knowledge retention within the Department of Veterans Affairs, indirectly impacting veteran healthcare outcomes.
